byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting, and Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and JEFFREY E. SINGER

abstract: Weiquin Ma, father of Qing Qing Kiemde, who was found stabbed to death few miles from their home in Queens, says Kiemde had been struggling with depression and recent divorce from her husband; police say case remains under investigation.
lead_paragraph: Qing Qing Kiemde, 28, was found dead in Kissena Corridor Park in Queens on Sunday. “She was such a good person. Always so kind to everyone,” her father, Weiqun Ma, said.

headline.main: Father’s Cry After Daughter’s Stabbing in Queens: ‘How Could She Be Killed in This Way?’
headline.print_headline: Father’s Plaintive Words After Daughter Is Killed

snippet: Qing Qing Kiemde, 28, was found dead in Kissena Corridor Park in Queens on Sunday. “She was such a good person. Always so kind to everyone,” her father, Weiqun Ma, said.
